xWQFd4Ibzy-znKxyOtcUHg.text: I went to this restaurant with my son and It was a really good restaurant compared to other Thai restaurants and I used to live in Thailand.

vNeT8f55nX-nKZW1g467mg.text: I came here a while ago, actually, I was taken out here,by  the parents of a friend. We all love Thai and were excited to try this place out.   The matre'd was a bit confused about the name we were reserved under- a minor glitch- and soon the five of us were seated for our meal. It was really crowded and loud (I think some rugby match was on) but they managed to remain efficient and we hardly waited for our food.   So to cut to the chase the food was actually quite good- at least my Gai Yang dish was. I am not a huge fan of too hot foods and the menu is helpful by showing the dishes that will make you tear up or what not.   We were a bit rushed through the meal though, they were obviously hoping for a quick turnover. Next time I hope they realise people want to enjoy a meal if they are going to pay restaurant prices for it, rather than being rushed through it then out in the cold again.

VnmWU601spHsjLn-qNT-Rg.text: Awesome authentic Thai food to go with fair prices and a great atmosphere.

gyuo8F8xMFbYfaIk9OJ7cA.text: Horrible service! Run away as fast as you can! Just amazed at the behavior of the owner/manager! Have never suffered from such ignominy in my entire life. We are well travelled and I would rate this restaurant with the most atrocious service one could ask for! Stay away..there are a lot of wonderful restaurants around the Royal mile. If there was an option to give zero stars I would!

5uoHmvvVmb9UlaLPPdYcgg.text: I wish Yelp had an option of ZERO stars! Do not waste your money & time here! We have travelled over 30 countries across the world and this restaurant takes the honors for WORST service ever! The manager/owner (lady) was extremely rude. The food took close to 45 mins to arrive...Avoid!!

d35XoQ_HHFTeWo6rPSO60w.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Edinburgh. It used to be down on Grindley Street but moved up to Johnston Terrace a few years ago.   The food here is lovely, very authentic thai and isn't overly flavored with coconut like some of the other thai restaurants in Ed.   The decor is very nice and calming and the staff are just lovely. Very curtious and friendly. They are always happy to advise and will help you choose if you are not used to thai food.   I used to live round the corner from the old restaurant and we regularly went here for take away - they still do takeaway in the new place. Worth it if you fancy a night at home and lovely food. I don't think they deliver and it not cheapest take away but worth it.   Try it - you won't regret it!

9wxkVrr3DQxdcpldpc8WzA.text: Food and service were excellent. Right off the Royal Mile near Edinburgh Castle. Tried sea bass for the first time at a Thai restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed. Not many tables so reserve ahead as the restaurant was completely full midweek.

gJPcD7w6L4BakGAjq4dAkQ.text: Visited this fantastic Thai restaurant twice now and will definitely eat here next time we are in Edinburgh. We booked a table for a Saturday night and so glad we did as every table was taken. Groups were being turned away as they hadn't booked and they looked disappointed! The restaurant has a warm and inviting atmosphere and the staff were all very polite and attentive. We opted for banquet B as it's a great way of trying a selection of dishes and finished every dish. The food was fantastic! The Thai Orchid has become our main reason to visit Edinburgh, fully worthy of a 5* rating!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Ca1MFe7nR6Jg6YIiYr7Egg.text: Very lovely restaurant and wonderful heartfelt service. If I lived in Edinburgh I would eat here twice a month if not more. The food was great. No MSG and the manager will suit your needs in adjusting dishes if you have special dietary restrictions. The waitress was very warm and affectionate too, wearing a traditional dress. The coconut ice cream was especially delicious having roasted coconut flakes mixed in and on top, giving a unique flavor in comparison to other coconut ice creams I have eaten. Food was perfectly cooked and flavored. And the bathroom was very clean which is not that common among Asian restaurants in the Americas. This restaurant is set within the old part of the city which is enjoyable to see too. I highly recommend it, just don't ask anyone who works there to take your photo because we did not get any good pics when doing so on my birthday. Cheers!

D4K8WPbHCdU20Iyq7KmHTA.text: This place doesn't even deserve a star, but that's the minimum I can use to post a comment.  My cousin, husband and I came here to eat dinner one night because it was close to the hostel, and we love Thai food.  We walked in and asked for a table for 3.  The maitre'd or server just said, "No table for 3"...and just stood there staring at us.  There were 2 unoccupied tables nearby so I said, "There's a table right there."  And she repeated, "No table for 3."  She obviously have not had any training in customer service because the least she could do was offer us seats at the bar, or tell us how long the wait will be.  Instead, she just stood there and stared at us like an idiot.  So I took the initiative and asked how long the wait is.  She said, "I don't know, 50 minutes?"  We walked out because I didn't feel like playing 20 Questions with an incompetent idiot.

ZEdap0gFv3sc7qEZ7H3LEQ.text: THIS is the best Thai food in Edinburgh. The prices aren't too bad and there are plenty of options for us vegetarians (something sadly lacking in other Edinburgh Thai restaurants). Highly recommend.

vMNI71qFcKEpCwWiS_Z1Gw.text: I visited this amazing restaurant on friday the 15th july 2011, i had been recommended by my friends. As soon i walked in the door i was made to feel most welcome, the restaurant inside is spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated.  The service was relaxed and freindly and our waitress explained some of the dishes I was curious about. When the starters arrvied, you could tell straight away they were made with love , fresh and very full of flavour.  I choose the Jungle Curry for my main, which the waitress explained was the hottest dish on the menu and was concerned that it would be too hot for me (which I thought was very considerate). When the main did arrive it was very spicy!! but not spicy for spicy sake, just hot and jammed packed full of flavour!! Without a doubt the best Thai Restaurant in Edinburgh!  I have eaten in all most all of them.  The place was very busy but we were never made to feel rushed or was the service compromised.  I cant say enough about this place! Please go and enjoy, But Book before you do!!

2JZ3UQnRQTPgLy5OwBZQIg.text: A hidden gem. Great food. Beautiful decor. Very clean and tidy. Good selection of wines. Good service, too.

rv5PR6CoXpjB9LXC08rM8w.text: Excellent Thai food, I found it hard to decide what to order as the menu is so good. Good service too, it was very busy on a Wednesday night as it is so popular.

Sx5Y9LcL0iUFU9yBHVDYYQ.text: This is the most authentic Thai we have been to in Scotland. The tom yum soup is the best we have ever had. We were just in Edinburgh for the weekend, but we'll definitely go back next time we are there. Good attentive service. Prices were reasonable given the quality of the food and service provided.

tjNfEfEf3eCI6m_4ToJOlQ.text: Really delicious food. Fantastic soups and starters. Tasty meat, seafood and veggie dishes, Really reasonably priced. I would recommend this restaurant whether you are out with friends or having a more intimate meal. A great atmosphere in a lovely location. Friendly service! I cant wait to go back.

yokdMjURSpA-IjTCI578Vw.text: I have travelled to Thailand and the food here is spot on. It is so authentic and for all it is expensive it is worth the price if you are a fan of thai food. It is at the top of the Royal Mile so has a great view from outside. There is a three course business lunch offer - warning it is extremely filling!

n5R6jn0_KkdIoVzb_WvfgQ.text: It was nice to have some flavor (and heat) in a meat and potatoes city. The location was easy, the ambience was mellow, and the service was warm and friendly.

R5eXCN_NCqs8h81BAJdH1Q.text: They totally messed up our order and were unwilling to make it right. There was a simple miscommunication, apparently the customer is always wrong at this restaurant. Food was decent but the poor customer service earned them a one star review.

1U2xhDZEkvW_ndIYU8vKBg.text: You guys...this might be the best Thai I've had on my life. Between the 4 of us, we has the Moussaman Curry, the Panang Curry, the Green curry and Pad Thai...all delicious. I had the coconut rice with my Curry and it was absolutely dreamlike. Delicious all around you guys...make sure to stop in!!

QwF1pOQ7VpO72i2PoyMJOQ.text: I came here for my boyfriend's birthday meal with his mother and aunt.  They had all been here before and had great reviews so I was very eager and excited to try some tasty thai!   The location of the restaurant is nicked away behind the castle. Apparently they were previously located at a much smaller location near the Usher Hall.  I immediately felt welcomed when I had entered and the smell of the food was very enticing.   The food was delicious! I particularly enjoyed the coconut rice.  Our waitress was very friendly and indeed funny - she made some very clever jokes!   Tip: When heading to the bathroom make sure to look out the window - excellent view of the city!

S-Mo1LcEZXaFfdLeXt0qgw.text: The Thai Orchid is the best Thai restaurant in Edinburgh and don't let anyone try to persuade you otherwise! I have been coming here for years and the food has always been consistently good.  The restaurant sits on Johnston Terrace just beneath Edinburgh Castle, so it's perfectly located for tourists who've been trawling the tartan tat shops on the Royal Mile. It is not a large restaurant, but they have put mirrors round the walls to create an illusion of space. The decor feels modern and Eastern, there is a large Buddha to greet you at the door, and the staff dress in traditional clothes which all adds to the authenticity of the place. The food is fresh and flavoursome and they never use MSG. I judge a good Thai on the quality of the Som Tum (papaya salad) and they know how to make a good one here - it's fresh, crunchy and with just enough of a chilli kick to pack a punch. My only complaint is that they don't do home delivery!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

C1SOjDLfNyro4P6XgUtJfA.text: Great dinner. Stopped in our first night in Edinburgh. Husband's sea bass was excellent. I had a spicy beef & peppers. Delicious!

ruFg8oVE6MDqLAgQzg0vTg.text: If you are in the mood for a good Thai meal, look no further than the Thai Orchid. Situated just around the corner from the Royal Mile, the Thai Orchid is right behind Edinburgh Castle and so it is an ideal place for tourists to stop off for a meal.   The inside of the restaurant is really modern, contemporary and spacious with plenty of tables and chairs and so it would be a great place to bring a large party. I came here for the first time several weeks ago and I had the most beautiful meal, and I can't wait to go back. Thai Orchid's menu offers a vast choice of authentic Thai dishes. I had the tempura prawns for a starter with a chili sauce which really amazing - it wasn't too heavy for a starter and the prawns were perfectly cooked. i then had the Thai prawn salad for my main course which was scrummy! The prawns were really tasty and was mixed with lots of Thai herbs and spices giving it lots of flavour. Each dish on the menu has a warning next to it showing how spicy it is which is very welcome as it means you won't get your head blown off with an unexpected chili and ruin your meal.   The prices at Thai Orchid are really reasonable, with most starters priced at about 5 and the majority of the main courses costing less than 10. This is a really fantastic Thai restaurant which is definitely worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zkzO-J_5DPJAC4e1DfyZvg.text: Atrocious service! Avoid...unless you want to get insulted!! We were staying on the Royal mile for a week and had some great food but our whole trip was soured by one lunch visit to this restaurant and very low level of service. The manager/owner was rather rude.

-OBJiKPyhd4X92-D-EOEzQ.text: Best Thai food I have had and I love Thai!  There were 4 people in our group and we all had different meals and all were great!  Get the coconut rice!  Service was also very personable.  Go there now!!

5xBN-1utsjeec486mCPsoQ.text: A restaurant with a very switched on owner with a great customer attitude.  I started with TODD MUN KAO PODE, deep fried sweet corn cakes. Normally served with a sweet and sour peanut dip, which they amended to a chilli dip for me. They were lovely and light and not at all greasy.  My friend Fraser had the PEEK GAI TODD, Spicy Thai style chicken wings which he enjoyed. For mains, I had KOW PAD KIEW WAN GAI, fried rice with chicken, vegetables and green curry. This was spicy without being too hot. Fraser went for MOO PAD KING, pork stir fried with ginger and mixed vegetables. Apart from the onions that he doesn't like unless well done, it was wolfed down.  For afters, we had a pot of Green Tea. We could have had coffee or Ice Cream.  The portion sizes were lovely for lunch.  I thoroughly enjoyed the meal, and look forward to going back one evening and try the full menu.  The bill for the 2 of us was 15.90 as we had no extra drinks. The restaurant is on twitter (@ThaiOrchid_) and on Facebook. After viewing their menu online, I used twitter to discuss alternatives as I have a mild peanut allergy. They responded very quickly, which resulted in me booking a table.  I am glad I did.

DVNjvtjpoirnGfb7xy6V6w.text: Went here for dinner based on reviews. We've been traveling for 10 days now and craving something spicy. Wow, wow, wow!!!! Reservations are a must. We saw many people turned away. The Tom Yum Goong soup was very spicy yet so flavorful, we sweated through to drain the bowl :) the veggie side dish was spicy perfection, the staff were welcoming and funny. We're going back once more before we leave!

gl1mExp9KOd-f_ll9vUbdw.text: Good Thai. In from The States, arrived looking for lunch. Good reviews on Yelp and was not disappointed. All our dishes were great, the Tom Kai soup, spring rolls, thai salad, and shrimp pad king. Decent prices in a pricey area and quality food.

i5mJ4Gf_8sfK_UiLqG0CCQ.text: Based on Yelp reviews, my husband and I decided to check this place out. I was a little skeptical as the restaurant is located right across the street from Edinburgh Castle, so I was expecting mediocre food since it is located in such a touristy area.   We stopped in for lunch and were greeted and seated immediately. I ordered the spicy chicken fried rice off the business lunch menu and it was fantastic. I will warn you though that when they say spicy, they mean it. It is not like in England when they say spicy and you can barely taste any flavor. It is more like spicy in the US where you suddenly need to take a Zantac for heartburn. I was pleasantly surprised and quite pleased with my meal which came with a starter and a dessert (vanilla ice cream, imported from Italy - I actually asked if it was homemade as it was so delish).  My husband ordered spicy beef with a side of fried rice. We both thought that his meal was overpriced for the portion size but he said it was tasty. I'd recommend ordering off the business lunch menu if you are there for lunch as you will get quite the break in price and will get a starter, main, and dessert.  Dress code is casual for lunch (jeans and a sweater is just fine). Cannot comment on dinner service.

gm6cTANkf8A5D_mFERbOMw.text: Thai Orchid is some of the most solid Thai food I have had in a long time, definitely the best I have had in the UK. I found it, as others have said, while wandering around Edinburgh Castle looking for somewhere to stop and eat. I was a bit wary of Thai in Scotland, but the menu looked good and I literally couldnt walk another step.   Upon entering the restaurant I noticed how clean and nicely decorated it was. The staff greeted us immediately and were very friendly. They remained that way for our entire meal.  The food was really outstanding. The prawn appetizer we had came with the most amazing sweet tamarind sauce. I could literally drink gallons of that sauce. The soup had the perfect mixture of coconut milk, lemongrass and spice. Our main entrees were great as well. Perfectly balanced flavors, everything cooked really well. The sticky rice with mango dessert was to die for. I also have to make note of the plating and presentation of each dish. So often places just skip this step when really most of us eat with our eyes before our mouths. The presentation here was stunning. Little carved vegetables, flowers, the works. It really made it a pleasure to eat.  I will definitely be returning to Thai Orchid next time I am in Edinburgh.

T2K20GaIjX-5C9mulnEmoQ.text: Great food in the shadow of Edinburgh. Look out for the Birdseye chillies in the Som Tam!

WApFJ7GQRBEKozutmGjJ6A.text: An amazing restaurant !! The staff, food and service were faultless. The manager was really kind and managed to squeeze my family and I in on a busy Friday night as we hadn't booked, too. Go here if you want a great Thai meal, but I would advise booking!

tVJG_ljYaCQaHJTje3iRXw.text: Enjoyed a Lovely meal here with friends. Can recommend the pad thai, it was fab.

v4VPadSrJ906rzHkiYDkqQ.text: I wondered around this part of town thinking I was going to have my kilt pulled down and I would be well and truly bug.....fleeced by some tourist trap of a restaurant and then I came across this place. A lovely lovely lovely place to eat traditional Scottish Thai Food.   All joking aside the food was scrummy (that means good to those of you who do not live in my world or use my lexicon). Scrummy I tell you!!!! The the green prawn curry - yum!!!! the red chicken curry - yummy!!! the pad thai - yummyerer!!!!   I confess I ate here on two occasions within a 24 hour period. It may have had something to do with the number of beers(gin and whisky) I have....I am not fessing up to anything.   The staff were nice and attentive. The place was clean and I will go again. Save yourself the anguish and do not look too far for somewhere decent to eat.

kBOu3pEe7ivqrufWXSYoAQ.text: I say this is the best Southeast Asian restaurant in Edinburgh and possibly UK.  The location is a "can't miss" being so close to the castle.  The decor is simple, spacious (might be something to do with the mirrors), clean and feels more modern than other Asian restaurants.  Service is above average.  On to the good part... I had the Good Pow prawns for starter.  The sweet ginger, salty prawn and spicy chili sauce combination was a great delight.  The prawns are not big, so don't rush to share them with your companions.  For main course, I had the GAI PAD MAMUANG HEEMAPAN (a.k.a #26).  I was simply looking for something mild and didn't have much to expect.  It turned out perfect!  First, every ingredient tasted fresh: the vegetables were spring and the chickens were not.  Again, excellent balance of sweet, salty and spicy flavors.  My bill was higher than average Asian restaurants: 20 pounds including tip, without desert.  But the top quality meal makes this place worth indulging.

kqzKF4G4dnWtNB_q439RLQ.text: Back home in NYC I've been on a crusade to eat my way through all the Thai restaurants in an area neighboring my apartment which is absolutely flooded with them, so in the middle of my week-long vacation in Edinburgh, I had a craving for something comfortable and familiar. I asked around, specifying that I wanted something authentic and unique and spicy and quaint, and time after time Thai Orchid came very highly recommended -- so of course I had to give it a couple visits.  Seafood is featured prominently on the menu, so on my first visit that's pretty much what my friend and I stuck to. We started with the butterflied prawns stuffed with seafood and pork that comes in an egg-wrapping. Then we had the rice-paper wrapped prawns stuffed with seafood. Then we had the deep-fried haddock with peanut sauce. For entrees I'd never seen this offered anywhere else, so I just had to have it: Larb with ground duck! Then we had the mixed seafood "Yum" salad. Then we got the mixed seafood in a red curry and coconut soup with bits of egg yolk... Everything was really good. My friend doesn't like spicy food so I was forced to eat things rather "mellow" but the ingredients all stood out prominently, we both really enjoyed ourselves.... We really bonded over the course of the evening, we tried to the best of our abilities to keep our googly-eyed butterflies-in-the-stomach pining cuddling canoodling respectfully under-wraps, though there might have been a few instances of publicly-displayed affection, thankfully we had some amazing food to distract us and inspire us... I would definitely describe this as a great place for a date, if you and the other person are even ever-so-slightly adventurous.  For my second visit, I wanted to be a little more adventurous than last time. With a different friend (who, unfortunately, also doesn't like spicy food, damn it) we split the poached Monkfish with coconut milk and crispy onions. Then we had the fried Monkfish in a tumeric and tamarind and ginger sauce. Then we had the red curry Roasted Duck with tomatoes and grapes and lychees. Then we had Sliced Duck that comes with a salad of mango and red peppers and garlic and basil and chili peppers... This meal was incredible, super high-quality ingredients, beautiful presentation...  The service is all very friendly -- our waitress was beautiful, and the traditional outfits they wear is very attractive it doesn't look at all look like or feel like a gimmicky uniform... They offer a nice selection of red wine and white wine boy the bottle or by the glass... The atmosphere is relaxed... The decor is modern and chic but not at all overwhelming or inappropriate.  I could easily see this as my favorite Thai restaurant if it were a little more local to me, but instead I'll just hope to come back sometime soon... At the conclusion of my second meal here (which was also my last meal while in town), walking back to pack my luggage, digesting and downloading and decompressing, I came to a realization: all my meals in Scotland were excellent, it was incredibly surprising to me, I never ate this well in London, not even close -- I seriously cannot wait to return.

YGy_gtgD17fds-RryWryKA.text: Gaeng pak was very good. However, it was not very hot despite being listed as one of the spicy curry options -- something to keep in mind while reading the spice labels on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

gPF9ACdghCWTe8Ovf7u6CQ.text: Thai food for dinner time please! I was excited to go to this place cause I was craving for Thai food and I live near it but never tried their food.   Their menu is pretty lengthy and can be overwhelming but it's great that they offer many different choices.  My friend and I chose two dishes...gaeng massaman neua which is a traditional mild curry with beef and chicken with cashews. The dishes were solid, nothing extraordinary not terrible... Solid Thai dish that has the Classic Thai flavours I love. I'd say the portions here are smaller than other their restaurants I've been to considering the price is a bit higher.   The staff were all welcoming and nice. There was always someone checking up on us and making sure the food was good... If you like being left alone and not get asked how the food is every 5 minutes than you might get annoyed here. The decor is lovely and the place is small which makes it intimate. Make sure you make reservations since it's a small place. Overall this place is a solid Thai restaurant and you won't be disappointed with the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

iTdWC7Jfs1mh4Um-2ToPlg.text: Very good food and very accommodating to a food allergy in our group. Not a large space so we were glad we got a table. Prices were reasonable for quality of the food.

iMfxk92ABLnQWODytuuPGw.text: Drunken noodle and pad puk "thai hot" were delicious and just the right amount of spice.  The vegetable rolls with steamed tofu were hot and tasty. Thai iced teas were no too sweet, but just right.  Good eats around the table.

6skh5PO60zifHV3gJ45H5w.text: Loved the pad Thai here and the green curry. I usually don't like coconut curry stuff but it was the perfect dish! Would definitely recommend anyone looking for authentic Thai food. They also have great dessert options as well.

i7OKxQ2ui8Es-bSdBPB1Mg.text: The food was delicious! I believe I got the duck with the mango, or something along those lines. Service was very quick and the staff was friendly. Drink prices were awful, though. Way too expensive. Food, luckily, made up for it.

PT4AqzgP3AC7iztdR_kFTw.text: Ate a solo dinner here. It was just a couple doors down from the Castle Rock hostel I was staying in Grassmarket area just down the hill from the Edinburgh Castle. It was not the best Thai meal I've ever had, but the food was decent, fresh, and was a very good dining experience. Pretty restaurant, too. The Summer (fresh) rolls were very nice as well as the green curry with coconut rice. Green tea in a pot was excellent. Friendly, competent service, too. Will definitely come here if I'm in Edinburgh again.

Y7I4cZBH4eaNLWmdcVDTbA.text: Good food worth a visit again for authentic thai food made just right with excellent service....

Ri2fL5xhQP3HvDdJHbr4UA.text: Food is ok. 72 for 2 person without alcohol. 1 lady had the worse attitude ever. Yelp has very good rating on this restaurant. I wonder why??? Maybe I am just unlucky today......

dN2AtT4NPJWAnIZbCOoXfA.text: Visited twice on our 5 day trip to Edinburgh. Amazing attentive service, delicious food, service with extensive menu knowledge- I am gluten free/vegan and had an entire page of items I could choose from. My husband had the spicy beef w veg, I had green curry w tofu. Had red curry 2nd visit- just as good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Appetizers-combo skewers, ribs, curry bites and veg spring  rolls. Yummy sauces.

fIGOQzFepH0FSWpe1CC8tA.text: Had lunch here before the Fringe and the food was delicious. Service was great and I would definitely come again whenever I'm in the area.

kbZWbkdLbRbed26CQZt0KA.text: This was a delightful surprise. We were a group of 12. They handled us politely and professionally. The food arrived promptly it was hot and wonderfully spiced. They handled special requests with ease. A real find in a superb location.

oyq29zEooPG2zJvsHRf5UQ.text: Stopped in for a quick group dinner while on vacation.  Expected the average quality Thai fare like in the U.S. (lots of peanuts, carbs, sugar, no spice) given the proximity to the tourist sites, but was pleasantly surprised with the authenticity here!  The flavors were diverse, bright, and "spicy" was appropriately spicy, not some piss-poor excuse for chili.  Pretty comparable to actual food in Thailand!  The presentation was beautiful and elegant. If I ever return, I want to try the Massamun.

BihnL9pgUGUvDZzrUcLotg.text: Tried here as thai is usually a good shout for gluten free options.  We arrived at 4.45pm and didn't have a booking.  The waitress said yes I can give you a table as long as you can be done by 8.30pm.  Not a problem!  She told anyone with no booking the time that they needed the table back by.  Some people may find this rude but I think it's better than being half way through your meal and being told to hurry up! I asked about the gluten free options and I nearly hugged her when she told me what I could have...every main course with the exception of 3, just wow!  There were six out of the 13 starters that I could have so we were on a roll before we even ordered. To drink my boyfriend ordered the thai iced tea with milk which may sound dodgy but far from it the flavours were perfect with what was ordered.  For starters we had the number 7 and number 8 (don't think these match the website exactly).  His was a marinated pork dish that was beautiful.  I'm not a big fan of pork but it was melt in the mouth tender.  Mine was a mince and peanut mixture wrapped in an egg net.  The egg net looked like batter almost so you expected a crunch but that didn't come until you reached the peanut.  Such an odd mixture that worked so well. For mains he ordered the Larb Issan dish with beef.  The only downside was that the spice was not quite as expected (it wasn't really spicy at all) but it was full of flavour and a very filling dish.  I had the Pedt orchid for mains which was verrry spicy and I loved it.  The mango mixed with the spicy duck was the perfect combination.  This dish managed to have lip numbing spice but yet have fantastic flavour which some places do struggle with.  At the end of this feast we were both stuffed and had no room for anything else.  When I'm back I will visit here again but will book a table to be sure! I would like to add from a non food point of view that the toilets were spotless!  This says a lot about a place.  Also while we were there a young couple came in with their teething baby and the staff cooed over the baby and distracted the baby as much as possible to let the couple eat their food.  I was amazed and so happy to have picked here.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Marinated pork
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pedt orchid
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Larb Isaan

Z7dseUG8CEt_jm6lu32PCQ.text: The best Thai food! I have been here on several occasions and continue to return. Food is always tasty. The atmosphere is nice and staff is great. Last night I had the chicken Penang curry and while not as much heat as I'm used to, it was still very nice with great flavor. The Som Tum, now that has a kick! Yumm!! It's in the middle of a very tourist spot in Edinburgh (right by the castle entrance) but it's not the feel you get from the restaurant. About my 4th or 5th visit and I'll continue to come back.

XubEx8il_3LMkIFaUC-3Nw.text: Great Thai food! Make sure to make a reservation though- it's very popular, and for good reason

-M6J96P8JUQ75IIWzoOZ1g.text: I had massaman curry with fried rice and egg - delicious!  Spring rolls were fantastic as well.

Lgt766MQWmztYm4RZeJUzw.text: The food was beautiful and fresh and so well presented. The staff were friendly, welcoming, lovely. Everything about our dining experience was just impeccable!

DzhYxud4fMoCr2VqvQC92w.text: My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary. We're both vegetarians, and although they don't have tons of options, there were a few that got our attention!   For starters we got the vegetarian "golden bags" with the plum sauce, which were delicious. I only wish we could have gotten more! We also ordered the spring rolls, which had a very smokey flavor.. Still good, just not the best spring rolls we've had.   We ordered 50 and 54 in the Vegetarian section. 50 had a yummy sauce, but was full of vegetables and lacking on the tofu side. This worked for me, but might not for those who aren't veggie fans. The other dish was a favorite, with another very tasty sauce and full of tofu goodness.   Overall, nice place to eat, great service, and I'd recommend the pineapple juice! But for the price, I'm not sure if it was as good as it should have been!!

vAEKzmme3X9FcEFedJv8BA.text: This place was excellent and had some Thai dishes I was not familiar with. Ducked in after a visit to the castle.   To start we had the chicken marinated in Thai whisky, soy sauce and sesame oil wrapped in a pandan leaf..umm YUMMM.  For my main I had the red curry with duck that had grapes, tomatoes, and lychees in it. I only found 1 lychee. :( The curry itself was delicious. Perfectly spiced and well seasoned but for the price I felt the portion was quite small, especially since you had to also buy the rice. It was a unique dish though, and I haven't seen it on the menu at any other Thai menu so I gave it an extra star for that. I felt like the food was quite tasty and perhaps for the location the pricing was right.   I will say that I saw a 3 course lunch menu for under 10 quid so if you're on a budget, duck by here for some basic Thai curry.

4lTiquZskeSIWy4aUAVZrw.text: It was nice to see a Thai restaurant in the Old Town tourist area near the castle in Edinburgh. The restaurant is tiny, but the prices are reasonable and the food is good. We had some service issues, but overall an enjoyable experience. Nice Decour.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

qfJ6HI7ek1CGE0xMDLDPWA.text: We stopped here because we were craving some Thai food. Boy, was this place a HUGE letdown. We ordered two orders of Pad See Ew.  On the menu, this dish is listed under the vegetarian dishes. We added beef to one dish and chicken to the other.  The portions were on the smaller side.  The biggest disappointment was there was no flavor!  It's like they forgot to add sauce or something.  Also, the beef was super tough. At closer examination, it looked like they steamed the beef and just threw it in the dish.  There was absolutely no flavor to the beef.    The mango and sweet rice was decent.  We left this place still hungry and disappointment.  I don't understand why this place had such high reviews. Maybe they don't specialize in Pad See Ew? I wouldn't come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The beef in Pad See Ew. Very tough and flavorless. It&#39;s like they steamed it. Avoid this dish.
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pad See Ew with added Chicken
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mango and Sweet Rice

Smd6S1mFbu81jpooE7-LmQ.text: Service was pretty decent. Had pad se ew.  Small portion and was almost like plain pasta.  No seasoning. What was unusual here is their pad Thai comes with no meat. After asking for chicken server asks confirms they can do for an extra pound charge.  Seems reasonable just expected meat with pad se ew.  Chicken was dry. Appetizer of chicken skewers was ok best part was the pretty presentation

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pad se ew
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zGBaZFDZDMcCeMPy8uByog.text: This is probably the worst Thai restaurant I've ever been to. Don't come if you know how authentic Thai food tastes like.

b7tXrDPKbmHds25fwW7Z-w.text: Best red curry I've ever had!  Go to Thai Orchid for a quiet, tasty meal of scallops and red curry. I've been living in Edinburgh for a few months and this restaurant might be the best place I've tried so far. It doesn't have the most exciting ambience, but you'll get a great meal on the royal mile for a price that won't break the bank.   If you're here on vacation, you may have noticed that Edinburgh restaurants love to cater to tourists by displaying all that Scottish food has to offer. That's well and good, but, after a couple of days, all that heavy, rather unhealthy food can leave you feeling bloated and sluggish. Come to Thai Orchid for a tasty change of pace and work some protein and vegetables into your diet.  Cherry on top: When you ask for the check, the waitress brings you a yummy piece of chocolate with crunchy orange bits.

wagBP72-PxB8i4JQDM8EJQ.text: We came in here on a cold rainy day longing for some soup. The restaurant is located close to the Edinburgh Castle and the service was good.   We had the Tom Yum Soup, Chicken Satay and Penang Chicken. The food came out great.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tom Yum Soup
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken Satay

35_mgL18Y40dQ6dN0DpNKw.text: If I could give a zero star, I would! The service is horrible and the food is meh. We were a group of 8 people. Although we were seated promptly as soon as we stepped in, the waitress did not tell us that the restaurant has a policy to only cater if guests order the same number of dishes (main, starters and soup) as the number of people. So, we were forced to order 8 dishes. It is not that we wanted to save money, but we have been tasting local food and wanted to look for light dinner. At that point, we were too embarrassed to leave since we have already ordered some drinks. We felt like it's a RIP-OFF for tourists since the restaurant is located in the Royal Mile and near the Edinburgh castle. STAY AWAY! There are a plenty of better Thai restaurants in the city!

fV2nxygCFAxy_XoEMtgCpA.text: The food was decent, just standard fare with nothing special to report. But the service was painfully slow. We went in after the lunch rush when  it was less crowded, but even then the staff were too preoccupied and uninterested to pay any attention to the tables. Shockingly difficult to order, get the food, have plates cleared, and then wait an eternity to pay the bill. Would not recommend unless you are hoping for an extremely long, drawn-out experience.

H49O2Z5uqGLBtmwGGMlEkQ.text: Would not recommend to come again.   We have ordered Pat Kee Mo with beef; Pad PaK; Tom Yum Soup with chicken and Green Curry with chicken (excuse my spelling but I hope it sounds about right so you still know what I am talking about).   The portion is quite big but none of the dish come with rice or noodles. Pat Kee Mo here is his spicily cooked meat dish. I have tried thai food many times before as it is one of my favorite cuisine l. From past experience this dish is always this yummy spicy wide rice noodles with meat. As I am not Thai so I couldn't tell you which one is more authentic but just want to help to adjust your expectation.   All the protein in our dishes are over cooked and it's the Tom Yum soup is not as tasty or refreshing as I have had before.   With that being said, the service is good and the restaurant is quite clean.

2XNassFGklzW7-zwO4G3Mg.text: This is our 3rd time in Edinburgh and we always make a trip to Thai Orchid. Everyplace I travel to, I always look for good Thai food but nothing has come close to Thai Orchid. Everything we have had here is great but especially like the Pad Thai  I would recommend reservations as they can be very busy. If you are looking for good Thai, don't over look them.

WO3fjaY59VoNsesyE1xyPg.text: Good food for a good price and additionally a very nice and friendly service... been there 3 times in a row now and have absolutely nothing to complain about.

Jy0C3Ze_M9uzD-wqTFDJBw.text: Looking for simple dinner and stumbled onto great Thai food. The tom kha gai (not proper name) soup was so flavorful and chicken was tender and plentiful. We shared the panang curry and it was also wonderful. Topped off dinner with yummy coconut ice cream. Had to stop ourselves from going back the next day for lunch! Service was also great. Definitely a do over when I come back to Edinburgh.

0y-OTXp1OdpET4CLDNh4zA.text: Greater by the warm and friendly staff by their signature "Thai smile" and subsequently served promptly two of the tastiest dishes you will find on the Royal Mile, pineapple fried rice with chicken and pad thai with prawns and chicken. Wonderful experience I would recommend to any and all looking for a comfortable and enjoyable culinary experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Thai Orchid Business Card
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Thai Orchid Business Card

qHjjZPcR7W8MdL2fICvcPQ.text: Great food - friendly service. Had pad Thai and mango sticky rice. Both great - would recommend. Cozy.

26MC32ha5F9dw1Vznm9Neg.text: Great Tom Khao soup. It wasn't crowded and prices reasonable which can be hard to find in DC. Our entire group of 4 enjoyed the meal. I would return.

kmVs-Fcxo2_FBdNz6VbOXg.text: This place was absolutely amazing.  It can get a bit busy so I'd advise booking a table but the food was great, the place is clean and pretty and the staff were super friendly.  I'd go back again for sure.

n4ovLwXrpS7zmx6LEtC-sQ.text: This restaurant is conveniently located near a touristy part of Edinburgh which usually means overpriced mediocre food. Fortunately, that wasn't the case and I quite enjoyed my meal here.   I ordered the Tom Yum Soup and the Red Curry and they were both delicious and flavourful. The soup in particular was way better than was you get in most Thai restaurants. If you're getting a curry, I would recommend trying it with coconut rice as they seem to make it really well here.   The service is prompt and the presentation of the food is very appetising. I'll definitely come back when I get the chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Vegetable Red Curry.
Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tom Yum Soup with Chicken. It was heavenly!

6La4VYtUcj5JqzGEw_1RNg.text: We needed a break from Scottish food so we decided to go Thai. I'm giving this 3 stars because they charged us separately for all of our rice at 3.25. I've actually never heard of a Thai restaurant that charges for rice. Other than that, it was acceptable. There's not much atmosphere - too bright.

km2XgpilLM9v1pbJKMIVOA.text: Great service, really friendly staff, tasty food and a beautiful authentic feel to the place.  Would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. This is the panang curry with steamed rice.

kdQgGveae7S-xvJxrELqkQ.text: Probably the best Thai food I've ever had! We had the vegetarian spring rolls to start. I feel like spring rolls are so heavy when fried. These were so light! And the sauce was the perfect blend of sweet and spice! For our entrees, we had the Penang curry with chicken and the Pad Thai with chicken. In both dishes, the meat was very good and not dry. The Panang curry was possible the best curry I've ever had. It was made with pineapple, peaches, and coconut milk, as well as red bell peppers. The flavors!! The Pad Thai was also very well made. We like our dish with a few more beansprouts to give it a bit of crunch, but the sauce was out of this world! Be careful of the pepper on the plate; it's super spicy!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Orchid - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pad Thai noodles!
